results.title: The Edge of Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Saskia Baron, Shana Swanson, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “American cinema”.
While many of the old rules are still in force, independent filmmakers often add their dissineting voices to the forum. This program looks at some alternative visions from new talents including Spike Lee, Joel and Ethan Coen, Jim Jarmusch and Quentin Tarantino. With limited budgets, they are challenging the stylistic status quo of the Hollywood film.

results.title: Dashes, hurdles and relays
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Athletics”.
A study of techniques for the 100 metres, 200 metres and 400 metres sprints; three types of good form for hurdling; and the technique of passing the baton in relay races.

results.title: The Safety supervisor
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Michael Spencer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film presents the problems confronting the safety supervisor in relation to both management and labor. It cites the case of Mr Gilchrist who found himself at loggerheads with management over apparent indifference toward safety protection, and with labor because of frequent negligence. The camera accompanies Mr Gilchrist and the manager on an inspection tour of the plant and records their observations on a number of typical accident hazards. As a result of a bandaged head acquired on the tour, Mr Gilchrist is able to reiterate with renewed emphasis the need for adequate safety measures.

results.title: Caninabis
results.creator_credit: Kaj Pindal, Gaston Sarault and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Caninabis is an animated film about a dog whose brilliant career on the drug squad collapses when he mistakes a truckload of fertilizer for marijuana, causing an uncalled-for “bust”. He is the victim of “burn-out”, brought on by protracted smoking of drugs. The film’s message is clear: smoking marijuana is definitely not good for dogs. Award: Zagreb.

results.title: Delia Smith's winter collection. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Twelve episodes filled with warm recipes for winter food by well-known culinary expert Delia Smith. Filmed from her home kitchen in Suffolk, Delia prepares a veritable feast of soups, starters, casseroles, seafood, roasts, poultry and desserts as well as winter baking. This program will undoubtedly get the mouth watering and the most reluctant cook back in the kitchen.

results.title: Under the rainbow = Sous l'arc-en-ciel
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A little good will goes a long way—between persons, and between nations. That is the lesson to be learned from this animated film. It begins with a confrontation between a man who grows flowers and a technologist who operates computers. A flower pops up in the computer room; a computer tape appears in the garden. Each man destroys the “foreign object.” When they come face to face they discover that understanding is better than distrust, respect better than hostility. Without dialogue.

results.title: Horizon
results.creator_credit: Claude Jobin, Normand Gregoire and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film without words, a sort of tone poem where the natural sounds of the road and the view from the cab of a long-distance truck create a sense of a man in a world apart. The movement of the speeding truck and the optical manipulation of what the driver sees have a mesmerising effect. Clouds seem to gather and break like a flock of sheep. The horizon beckons elusively. The driver seems a prisoner of space and time.

results.title: 101 dalmatians
results.creator_credit: Stephen Herek, John Hughes, Ricardo Mestres, Great Oaks and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: This live-action adapted version of Dodie Smith’s classic children’s story will delight and amaze the whole family. Cruella De Vil (Glenn Close) is a woman with a passionate obsession for fur coats. Her quest is to have a coat made from the skin of the sweet dalmation pups owned by Anita and her husband Roger. The pups are kidnapped by two bumbling henchmen and Pongo and Perdita, the pups’ parents, enlist a canine army to execute a daring rescue. The special effects are outstanding as are the performances by an excellent cast, particularly Glenn Close. Co-starring Joely Richardson, Jeff Daniels, Joan Plowright and Hugh Laurie.

results.title: Once upon a time in China
results.creator_credit: Tsui Hark, Film Workshop and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The first of one of the classic Kung Fu films starring champion Jet Lee as legendary martial arts folk hero Wong Fei Hung. Set in a time when foreign traders and Jesuit priests were beginning to enter China, Wong Fei Hung leads the Black Army, a local militia determined to protect the town against the evil forces which operate in it. An action film which will amaze and astound as Jet Lee performs a series of heroic feats, defeating any evil in his path. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: History of Australia (PC)
results.brief_description: Provides a detailed account of Australia’s history based on a thematic format with significant events. Contains over 50 minutes of video and hundreds of pictures. The CD-ROM has lots of features such as notes and highlights, memory function and advanced search functions and is an excellent educational resource. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: MPC compliant PC386 DX, Hard disk, CD-ROM, Windows 3.1, 256 colour windows display driver. Also runs in Windows 95.
